perturbation.original_text: The representations and warranties in this Agreement shall terminate one year from the Closing Date, and such representations or warranties shall thereafter be without force or effect, except any claim with respect to which notice has been given to the party to be charged prior to such expiration date.
perturbation.changed_text: The representations and warranties in this Agreement shall terminate 90 days from the Closing Date, and such representations or warranties shall thereafter be without force or effect, except any claim with respect to which notice has been given to the party to be charged prior to such expiration date.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the survival period of representations and warranties to 90 days may be considered unconscionable or against public policy, especially in complex transactions. Nevada law does not specify a minimum survival period, but unreasonably short periods can be challenged in court.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Revised Statutes and common law principles regarding fair dealing and unconscionability in contract law.

perturbation.original_text: All notices, requests, demands, and other communications required or permitted hereunder will be in writing and will be deemed to have been duly given when delivered by hand, by overnight courier, or fax, or two days after being mailed by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, with postage prepaid.
perturbation.changed_text: All notices, requests, demands, and other communications required or permitted hereunder will be in writing and will be deemed to have been duly given when sent by email.
perturbation.explanation: Requiring notice only via email may be insufficient and conflict with legal requirements for certain types of notices. Nevada law might require specific methods for legal notices. Relying solely on email could create issues of proof of delivery and receipt, especially in legal disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Rules of Civil Procedure concerning service of process and notice requirements in legal proceedings.

perturbation.original_text: Each party will pay its or his own legal fees and other expenses in connection with the preparation of this Agreement and the sale of Assets in accordance with this Agreement. However, if any legal action or other proceeding is brought for the enforcement of this Agreement, or because or arising out of an alleged dispute, breach, default or misrepresentation in connection with any of the provisions of this Agreement, the prevailing party will be entitled to recover reasonable attorneyâ€™s fees and other costs incurred in that action or proceeding, in addition to any other relief to which it or he may be entitled.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will pay its or his own legal fees and other expenses in connection with the preparation of this Agreement and the sale of Assets in accordance with this Agreement. Under no circumstances will any party be entitled to recover attorney's fees, regardless of the outcome of any legal action.
perturbation.explanation: Eliminating the prevailing party's right to recover attorney's fees in all circumstances might be unenforceable or against public policy in some cases. While Nevada generally respects contractual agreements on attorney's fees, there are situations where statutes or common law principles allow or mandate fee-shifting, overriding the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Revised Statutes concerning attorney's fees in specific types of actions, and common law exceptions to the American Rule regarding attorney's fees.
